segment.source: Distribute apps to your employees from the Windows Store for Business (Windows 10)
segment.target: Distribute apps to your employees from the Windows Store for Business (Windows 10)

segment.source: Distribute apps to your employees from Windows Store for Business.
segment.target: Distribute apps to your employees from Windows Store for Business.

segment.source: You can assign apps to employees, or let employees install them from your private store.
segment.target: You can assign apps to employees, or let employees install them from your private store.

segment.source: Distribute apps to your employees from Windows Store for Business.
segment.target: Distribute apps to your employees from Windows Store for Business.

segment.source: You can assign apps to employees, or let employees install them from your private store.
segment.target: You can assign apps to employees, or let employees install them from your private store.

segment.source: In this section
segment.target: In this section

segment.source: Topic
segment.target: Topic

segment.source: Description
segment.target: Description

segment.source: Distribute apps using your private store
segment.target: Distribute apps using your private store

segment.source: The private store is a feature in Store for Business that organizations receive during the sign up process.
segment.target: The private store is a feature in Store for Business that organizations receive during the sign up process.

segment.source: When admins add apps to the private store, all employees in the organization can view and download the apps.
segment.target: When admins add apps to the private store, all employees in the organization can view and download the apps.

segment.source: Your private store is available as a tab in the Windows Store, and is usually named for your company or organization.
segment.target: Your private store is available as a tab in the Windows Store, and is usually named for your company or organization.

segment.source: Only apps with online licenses can be added to the private store.
segment.target: Only apps with online licenses can be added to the private store.

segment.source: Assign apps to employees
segment.target: Assign apps to employees

segment.source: Administrators can assign online-licensed apps to employees in their organization.
segment.target: Administrators can assign online-licensed apps to employees in their organization.

segment.source: Distribute apps with a management tool
segment.target: Distribute apps with a management tool

segment.source: You can configure a mobile device management (MDM) tool to synchronize your Store for Business inventory.
segment.target: You can configure a mobile device management (MDM) tool to synchronize your Store for Business inventory.

segment.source: Store for Business management tool services work with MDM tools to manage content.
segment.target: Store for Business management tool services work with MDM tools to manage content.

segment.source: Distribute offline apps
segment.target: Distribute offline apps

segment.source: Offline licensing is a new licensing option for Windows 10.
segment.target: Offline licensing is a new licensing option for Windows 10.

segment.source: With offline licenses, organizations can download apps and their licenses to deploy within their network, or on devices that are not connected to the Internet.
segment.target: With offline licenses, organizations can download apps and their licenses to deploy within their network, or on devices that are not connected to the Internet.

segment.source: ISVs or devs can opt-in their apps for offline licensing when they submit them to the Windows Dev Center.
segment.target: ISVs or devs can opt-in their apps for offline licensing when they submit them to the Windows Dev Center.

segment.source: Only apps that are opted in to offline licensing will show that they are available for offline licensing in the Store for Business.
segment.target: Only apps that are opted in to offline licensing will show that they are available for offline licensing in the Store for Business.

segment.source: This model means organizations can deploy apps when users or devices do not have connectivity to the Store.
segment.target: This model means organizations can deploy apps when users or devices do not have connectivity to the Store.
